page.title: 06A Wolverhampton Indian Boy.
page.content: When my mum goes to Indian shops she doesn't have any problems buying food and clothes.My sister or I normally help her when she visits English shops because she speaks very little English although she copes pretty well.We live in a semi-detached house with three double bedrooms upstairs.At home I speak Punjabi to my parents and English sometimes to my sisters.We eat both types of food;Western food such as pie and chips;Indian food like meats and chappaties.We go to an Indian Temple on Sunday about once a month.It is called Ramaria.There are Indian men at the front who sing songs and talk.My sisters and I understand some of it but my mum and dad understand it all. By Paramjit Sidhu,St Judes C of E Junior School.
